intro: Corryocactus pulquinensis, commonly known as the pulquin cactus, is a species native to the Andean regions of South America. It is characterized by its short, cylindrical stems that are often covered in white or pale green spines. The plant produces yellow flowers during the summer months, which are typically clustered at the tips of the stems. It thrives in well-drained soil and requires full sun exposure. Due to its unique appearance and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
